name: Hisense Energy Star 50 Pt 2-Speed Dehumidifier with Built-In Pump, DH-50KP1SDLE

reviews.name: Hisense Energy Star 50 Pt 2-Speed Dehumidifier with Built-In Pump, DH-50KP1SDLE
reviews.reviewText: The unit was easy to install and once set up began working as designed immediately. The material needed (tubing) to complete the install was included and no real skill is required. The unit has been working consistantly for 2 weeks now and so far so good.
reviews.title: Very easy to install

reviews.name: Hisense Energy Star 50 Pt 2-Speed Dehumidifier with Built-In Pump, DH-50KP1SDLE
reviews.reviewText:
Live in Eastern part of West Va about 85 mi West of Washington, D.C. Purchased product in July 2014 for in basement (1056 sq. ft.' which is divided into two unfinished rooms) after central air-conditioning was installed. Product was easy to set up - I ran the included drain tubing up to and across ceiling and down into a sink. Basement no longer has a musty smell when closed up and very humid outside. Basement also feels cooler than when I ran our old unit (another brand) which made it noticably hotter down there.

My daughter and son-in-law bought the 70 pint unit for their basement and are also very satisified with it.

Spoke with the compay and was told that if left running continuously it only uses 1600KW per yr. Will have to monitor the electric bill and see how it is effected.

Found directions easy to unmderstand - Keeps basement at 48% humitity on continuous setting.
Would highly recommend either the 50 or 70 pint units.
reviews.title: Definitely recommend produce

reviews.name: Hisense Energy Star 50 Pt 2-Speed Dehumidifier with Built-In Pump, DH-50KP1SDLE
reviews.reviewText: I have had this running on Automatic in my cellar for 3 weeks, 24 hrs a day. The area is dry and free of any wet smell. The unit is fairly quiet as well.
reviews.title: This units works!

reviews.name: Hisense Energy Star 50 Pt 2-Speed Dehumidifier with Built-In Pump, DH-50KP1SDLE
reviews.reviewText:
I am returning this unit because it puts out so much heat that the central air unit kept cutting on even when set at 80 degrees.

This increase in air conditioning use equals increased electric bill!

By the way I returned the initially delivered unit because it had been dropped in shipping and the water bucket was cracked pouring water on the floor! Purchased another unit just like it at another store only to encounter the heat issue.
reviews.title: Great removal of moisture but emits too much heat.

reviews.name: Hisense Energy Star 50 Pt 2-Speed Dehumidifier with Built-In Pump, DH-50KP1SDLE
reviews.reviewText: We like it and love the built in pump, but no where on description did it state fan would be on pretty much constantly. With the cost of elec. not too happy about that since every bit counts. Other than that, happy with machine.
reviews.title: It was all what I expected, but fan on all the tim
